critique: The document establishes an interagency committee on trade in automotive goods, focusing on the implementation, enforcement, and modification of provisions of the USMCA agreement related to automotive goods. It aims to review the operation of the agreement, including the economic effects of automotive rules of origin on the US economy, workers, and consumers, and the impact of new technology on such rules. The committee is composed of several secretaries and representatives from different departments and agencies. It emphasizes consensus-based decision-making but allows for majority votes if necessary. The document directs the Secretary of the Treasury, the Secretary of Labor, and the Commissioner of U.S. Customs and Border Protection to issue regulations and measures to implement section 202A of the Act. It includes general provisions regarding expenses, authorities, and legal enforceability.
